page.description: The FILE.EXISTS() method determines if a file or directory exists on disk. A logical result of TRUE (.T.) is returned if the supplied Filename is found.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script checks to see if the defaults file already exists. If not, the defaults file is created.
section.example: filename = "c:\a5\defaults.txt" result = file.exists(filename) if result = .F. then answer = ui_msg_box("","File does not exist. Create a new one? ", UI_YES_NO) 'user answered "No". if answer = UI_NO_SELECTED then end end if file_pointer = file.create(filename, FILE_RW_EXCLUSIVE) file_pointer.write("Defaults:") else end end if file_pointer.flush() file_pointer.close()
